HashedExpression-0.1.0.0

Safe HaskellNone
LanguageHaskell2010

HashedExpression.Internal.Pattern

Description

(c) 2014 Christopher Kumar Anand Helper functions/instances to make pattern guards involving Expressions easier to read.

Synopsis

  • type ListCapture = Int
  • type PowerCapture = Int
  • type RotateAmountCapture = Int
  • data PatternList = PListHole (Pattern -> Pattern) ListCapture
  • data PatternPower
    • = PPowerHole PowerCapture
    • | PPowerConst Int
    • | PPowerMul PatternPower PatternPower
    • | PPowerSum PatternPower PatternPower
  • data PatternRotateAmount

    • | PRotateAmountNegate PatternRotateAmount

matchList :: ExpressionMap -> [Int] -> PatternList -> Maybe Match Source #

Matches all nodes in the expression to see if they all match the PatternList, if they match, return the inner actual nodes e.g: matchList [a + (b * x), a + (b * y), a + (b * z)] (PatternList: (a + (b * _)) ---> Just [x, y, z] matchList [x, y, z, t] (PatternList: (_)) = Just [x, y, z, t] matchList [1 + x, 2 + x, y + x] (PatternList: (a + _)) = Nothing (not the same for all)

type NodeId = Int Source #

Match is the result we get when match an Expression against a Pattern

type PowerValue = Int Source #

emptyMatch :: Match Source #

unionMatch :: Match -> Match -> Match Source #

match :: (ExpressionMap, Int) -> Pattern -> Maybe Match Source #

Match an expression with a pattern, return the map between capture hole to the actual node e.g: match (Expression: (a(3243) + b(32521)) (PatternNormal:(x(1) + y(2)) --> ({1 -> 3243, 2 -> 32521}, {}) match (Expression sum(a(3243), b(32521), c(21321)) (PatternNormal:(sum(each(1))) --> ({}, {1 -> [3243, 32521, 21321]})
